United States Department of State / Foreign relations of the United States. Conference at Quebec, 1944
			(1944)

 Conference documents and supplementary papers, pp. 385-480
			
 PDF (34.4 MB) 



Page 412


THE SECOND QUEBEC CONFERENCE
a full report to Washington 1 which will undoubtedly become available
to British in due course but that the War Office would be grateful if
General Wilson in the meantime could transmit a copy of this report
with his comments urgently so that it might be available to the War
Cabinet. War Office also requested any additional pertinent informa-
tion on this subject.
 KIRK
 'See ante, p. 210.
Hopkins Papers
 JThe President's Special Assistant (Hopleins) to the President
'TOP STCRET [WASHINGTON,] September 13, 1944.
 MEMORANDUM FOR THE PRESIDENT
 DEAR MR. PRESIDENT: I have had several talks with General
O7Dwyer, Crowley and the State Department relative to the Italian
busness. The attached memo supplements the statement which you
hi.ax e with you on Italy.2
 It setms to ine that there are great advantages to be accrued to us if
you can take the initiative and get Churchill's approval to a course of
action. which you would announce publicly.
 Tie mnachinery for getting quick action relative to immediate relief
anud the purchase of material for economic rehabilitation is available.
The Italians can pay for all of the goods to be bought in this country,
other tiian emnergency relief supplies, out of funds which would accrue
to them f romi our soldiers' pay.
 The Prisoner of War business, I think, should be cleared up just as
soon as possible and, of equal importance, is the obvious necessity of
amn-endinu the Armistice ter ms.
 H[ARRY] L. II[OPKINS]
 [Attachment]
 Memorandum Prepared in the Department of State 3
CO1N1PIiENTIAL AND PERSONAL [Undated.]
 MEMORANDUM FOR MR. HOPKINS, THE WHITE HOUSE
 I refer to Mr. Jones' conversation with you Monday morning, Sep-
-teilbeI '11.
 Sent to Quebec by pouch.
 2Ante, p. 207.
 Neither the copy of this memorandum in the Hopkins Papers nor the Depart-
ment of State record copy (863.50/9-1344) indicates who initialed this paper
for
transmittal to Hopkins. It was drafted on September 13, 1944, by J. Wesley
Jones
of the Division of Southern Euiropean Affairs.
